thig13.5:1.1: “I was so young, my clothes so fresh,
thig13.5:1.2: at that time I heard the teaching.
thig13.5:2.1: and then I became profoundly dispassionate
thig13.5:3.3: and my flourishing villages and lands,
thig13.5:4.2: all that is no small wealth.
thig13.5:4.3: Now that I’ve gone forth in faith like this,
thig13.5:4.4: in the true teaching so well proclaimed,
thig13.5:5.1: since I desire to have nothing,
thig13.5:5.3: to take back gold and money,
thig13.5:5.4: having already got rid of them.
thig13.5:6.2: doesn’t lead to peace and awakening.
thig13.5:6.4: it’s not the wealth of the noble ones;
thig13.5:10.1: My family, why do you urge me on
thig13.5:10.2: to pleasures, as if you were my enemies?
thig13.5:11.1: It’s not due to gold, coined or uncoined,
thig13.5:11.2: that defilements come to an end.
thig13.5:11.3: Sensual pleasures are enemies and murderers,
thig13.5:11.4: hostile forces that bind you to thorns.
thig13.5:12.1: My family, why do you urge me on
thig13.5:12.2: to pleasures, as if you were my enemies?
thig13.5:12.4: shaven, wrapped in my outer robe.
thig13.5:13.4: the essentials of the homeless life.
thig13.5:14.3: Safe in their sanctuary, they are freed,
thig13.5:15.1: May I not encounter sensual pleasures,
thig13.5:15.2: for no shelter is found in them.
thig13.5:15.3: Sensual pleasures are enemies and murderers,
thig13.5:16.1: Greed is an obstacle, a threat,
thig13.5:17.2: sensual pleasures are like a snake’s head,
thig13.5:18.1: Stuck in the swamp of sensuality,
thig13.5:18.2: there are so many ignorant in the world.
thig13.5:18.3: They know nothing of the end
thig13.5:19.2: people jump right on to the path <j>that goes to a bad place.
thig13.5:20.1: That’s how sensual pleasures create enemies;
thig13.5:20.2: they are so tormenting, so corrupting,
thig13.5:20.3: trapping beings with the world’s material delights,
thig13.5:20.4: they are nothing less than the bonds of death.
thig13.5:21.3: They’re a snare laid by Māra
thig13.5:22.2: they’re full of suffering, a terrible poison;
thig13.5:22.3: offering little gratification, they’re makers of strife,
thig13.5:23.1: Since I’ve created so much ruination
thig13.5:23.3: I will not relapse to them again,
thig13.5:23.4: but will always delight in quenching.
thig13.5:24.4: for the ending of all fetters.
thig13.5:25.4: by which the hermits have crossed over.”
thig13.5:26.1: “Look at this: Subhā the smith’s daughter,
thig13.5:26.3: She has entered the imperturbable state,
thig13.5:26.4: meditating at the root of a tree.
thig13.5:27.1: It’s just eight days since she went forth,
thig13.5:27.2: full of faith in the beautiful teaching.
thig13.5:27.4: she is master of the three knowledges, <j>conqueror of death.
thig13.5:28.1: This one is freed from slavery and debt,
thig13.5:28.4: she has completed the task and is free of defilements.”
thig13.5:29.1: Thus did Sakka, lord of all creatures,
thig13.5:29.2: along with a host of gods,
thig13.5:29.3: having come by their psychic powers,
thig13.5:31.1: The Book of the Twenties is finished.
